raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences:

The antibody had a binding affinity (EC50) of about 4 ng/mL for NKG2A+ cells (K<sub>D</sub>˜4 ng/mL).
The K<sub>D </sub>for full receptor occupancy (the EC100) was about 100 ng/ml.
The EC50 concentration (the amount that provides a 50% of maximum) in the CD107 mobilization assay was determined to be about 400 ng/ml, and the EC100 was about 10,000 ng/ml (10 μg/ml).
The dose of 4 mg/kg provided an initial (peak) blood concentration of about 100 μg/ml, i.e. at about the EC<sub>100 </sub>for efficacy in tissues, and a continued (minimum) blood concentration above 30 μg/ml up to the two week time point, or, as of the fourth dose a continued (minimum) blood concentration of approximately 100 μg/ml.
The dose of 10 mg/kg provided a continued (minimum) blood concentration approximately 100 μg/ml.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

An anti-NKG2A antibody can advantageously bind to an extracellular portion of NKG2A with a KD that is at least 100 fold lower than the KD for binding to NKG2C.
The antibody can for example have an EC50 for binding (high affinity) to NKG2A-expressing cells of between 0.5-10 ng/ml, optionally 1-5 ng/ml, optionally 1-10 ng/ml, optionally 1-20 ng/ml, e.g. about 4 ng/ml.

final_json.value: <100 fold lower than the KD for binding to NKG2C

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* A sigmoid Emax model was used to fit the plasma concentration-effect relationship, with an EC50, defined as the serum drug concentration to reach 50% of Emax, i.e. 50% of NKG2A occupancy here for IPH2201.
* Results of modelling are shown in FIG, substantially complete (at least 90%) receptor saturation of NKG2A+ cells can be achieved by administering 0.03 mg/kg every two weeks for IPH2201.
* A dose of 0.1 mg/kg can be administered every four weeks to maintain substantially complete saturation of NKG2A for IPH2201.
* If saturation in the extravascular tissue (e.g, a solid tumor) is desired, an approximately 10-fold higher dose is believed to be needed, translating to a dose of about 0.4 mg/kg every two weeks, 1 mg/kg every four weeks for IPH2201.
* The results for saturation of NKG2A receptors from this human clinical trial was consistent with the in concentration of anti-NKG2A required for full receptor occupancy (the EC100) determined in vitro (see Example 4) for IPH2201.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

1. The 0.01 μg/mL (10 ng/mL) dose is approximatively at the EC50 of the cetuximab effect.
2. Anti-NKG2A antibody whose heavy chain amino acid sequence is shown in SEQ ID NO: 3 and whose light chain amino acid sequence is shown in SEQ ID NO: 7 was used at a final concentration of 10 μg/mL corresponding to full functional activity, and EGFR inhibitor cetuximab was used at two suboptimal doses of 0.001 μg/mL or 0.01 μg/mL.
3. Cetuximab was used at two suboptimal doses of 0.001 μg/mL and 0.01 μg/mL (˜EC50) and at a saturating dose of 0.1 μg/mL in these experimental settings.
4. Cetuximab was tested at a dose response, 1/10 serial dilution starting at 10 μg/mL.
